intro: Trimezia eburnea, commonly known as the white trimezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Trimezia eburnea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
